info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 8:27PM EDT until April 8 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River.
Eel River at Bowling Green.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River.
.Significant flooding is already occurring along the White River due to multiple rounds of heavy rainfall that brought around 5 to 9 inches to the area. Major flooding is expected from Spencer downstream on the White. The crest on the upper White should reach Noblesville Monday morning, with much of the middle White cresting Monday and Petersburg and Hazleton not cresting until the end of the week.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Anderson.
* WHEN...Until Tuesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, City of Anderson notifies residents in/along the following areas to make preparations for evacuation: Park Place, Hollywood Estates, and Alexandria Pike. Cross Street is closed between Alexandria Pike and Crystal Street. This area could flood at a lower level as it did in May 2002. Floodwaters begin to fill Phar-Mor Plaza parking lot. Dewey Street Plant of Anderson Water Pollution Control is affected by floodwaters. Athletic Park begins to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM EDT Sunday was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Tuesday morning and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Monday morning by around 1130 AM EDT /1030 AM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING
